channel.title: Vista. What do you think about it
channel.description:
What do you think about vista ? Well Today on the IRC there was a debate about it. What do you think about it? [URL=http://img107.imageshack.us/my.php?image=vistanj6.png][IMG]http://img107.imageshack.us/img107/8214/vistanj6.png[/img][/URL]
DEBATE!

item.title: Vista. What do you think about it
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

Gotta love integrated GPUs <3

spinds desktop around as fast as possible while typing for fun[br][size=1]Posted on: February 12, 2007, 08:35:03 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:1, topic:57875”]So your using linux only beryl and windows only D3D at the same time?[/quote]

nope, on linux you have multiple desktops.

beryl maps them all to faces of a cube, you can spin the cube around and see multiple desktops spinning around at once. watch the youtube vid. there are also many flash clones of the cube lol

Read full topic

item.title: Vista. What do you think about it
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

You must be pretty stupid to still think its a UI upgrade.
and its going to be several bytes different even if it was, MS has to resign the executables each release.

Read full topic
item.source: Vista. What do you think about it

item.title: Vista. What do you think about it
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“DeadBird, post:16, topic:55525”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=78731.msg870049#msg870049 date=1170775535]
No. Vista is simply a nicer UI. The software is configured to support the UI less noticably, but still it’s mostly the UI. That in fact is why Windows is so popular: It’s UI is clear and easy to use.

Vista is just like … Windows for the person who’s more interested in style than functionality.
[/quote]
I didn’t know it took 14gb for a “nicer UI”
Microsoft probably added nearly 750 features is my guess. Import internal stuff: improved the NTFS filesystem, rewrote the NT kernel, added usable apps (!!), etc. You can’t bash Vista without trying it.[/quote]

I’m running XP right now. I bet you have LSASS CSRSS and SMSS running right now just as I do.

I’ll post their sizes, tell me if your shiny new vista has even one byte different

csrss.exe: 6144 bytes
lsass.exe: 13312 bytes
smss.exe: 50688 bytes

Read full topic
item.source: Vista. What do you think about it

item.title: Vista. What do you think about it
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

Freedom wise(as in the i-own-my-hardware-so-i-should-be-able-to-do-what-i-want-with-it-and-i-dont-want-to-be-spied-on-by-some-company-or-movie-producers kind of freedom), it’s not good at all.

But I guess if you want a more(to be seen?) secure system than XP with a nice interface that’s much more of a pain to use because of those damn UAC popups then you could use Vista.

“Why would anyone make a bad product as an upgrade?”
Windows ME was a bad product, it was a upgrade & was worse than Windows 98.

Read full topic

item.description:
@parad0x wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:11, topic:55525”][quote author=wonderguy6 link=topic=78731.msg870059#msg870059 date=1170775750]

No, of course it has a point. Maybe you should pay more attention: Vista is targeted at those who seek style over functionality. Do you get the point now?

WHAT EVER
[/quote]
You really bug me. Stop acting like a know-it-all. You’ve been here, what, 2 months? Stfu, already.[/quote]
I concur. Wonderguy is a n00b, get a life.
If you knew anything you would think Linux was amazing.

item.title: Vista. What do you think about it
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

[quote=“DeadBird, post:16, topic:55525”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=78731.msg870049#msg870049 date=1170775535]
No. Vista is simply a nicer UI. The software is configured to support the UI less noticably, but still it’s mostly the UI. That in fact is why Windows is so popular: It’s UI is clear and easy to use.

Vista is just like … Windows for the person who’s more interested in style than functionality.
[/quote]
I didn’t know it took 14gb for a “nicer UI”
Microsoft probably added nearly 750 features is my guess. Import internal stuff: improved the NTFS filesystem, rewrote the NT kernel, added usable apps (!!), etc. You can’t bash Vista without trying it.[/quote]
Exactly. There was a vista expo at ma local center. Belive me vista is AMAZING!

Read full topic

item.title: Vista. What do you think about it
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:6, topic:55525”]No. Vista is simply a nicer UI. The software is configured to support the UI less noticably, but still it’s mostly the UI. That in fact is why Windows is so popular: It’s UI is clear and easy to use.

Vista is just like … Windows for the person who’s more interested in style than functionality.[/quote]
I didn’t know it took 14gb for a “nicer UI”
Microsoft probably added nearly 750 features is my guess. Import internal stuff: improved the NTFS filesystem, rewrote the NT kernel, added usable apps (!!), etc. You can’t bash Vista without trying it.

Read full topic

item.title: Vista. What do you think about it
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Wow, this is why I hate people who bash Microsoft/Apple.
They put “__ ftw!” “___ SUCKS!”, blah blah blah.
Post why you hate it, don’t just become another retard who’s opinion is very biased.
Yes, it has a nicer UI, but it’s not just some updated and shiny version of XP.
You might say it is, but you know it’s not.

-Mh

Read full topic
